docs.abstract: The growing epidemic is generating heavy news coverage, but companies are nervous about being associated with the outbreak.
docs.snippet: The growing epidemic is generating heavy news coverage, but companies are nervous about being associated with the outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: The CNN show “Erin Burnett OutFront” spent much of its time on Friday focused, like many other news programs, on the coronavirus outbreak and the thousands of people isolated on the Grand Princess cruise ship near California.

headline.main: Cruise Line Ads Get Caught in a Coronavirus News Cycle
headline.print_headline: When Outbreak Coverage Is Brought to You by a Cruise Line

docs.abstract: New federal data-sharing requirements will enable people to use consumer apps to retrieve their medical information directly from their doctors.
docs.snippet: New federal data-sharing requirements will enable people to use consumer apps to retrieve their medical information directly from their doctors.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a move intended to give Americans greater control over their medical information, the Trump administration announced broad new rules on Monday that will allow people for the first time to use apps of their choice to retrieve data like their blood test results directly from their health providers.

headline.main: New Data Rules Could Empower Patients but Undermine Their Privacy
headline.print_headline: New Data Rules Empower Patients, But Risk Privacy

docs.abstract: In the two years since Disney announced it would move its New York offices to Hudson Square, the former manufacturing district has risen in stature.
docs.snippet: In the two years since Disney announced it would move its New York offices to Hudson Square, the former manufacturing district has risen in stature.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the Walt Disney Company announced in 2018 that it would leave its longtime home on the Upper West Side of Manhattan for a former manufacturing district downtown named Hudson Square, some people may have scratched their heads.

headline.main: With Disney, a Manhattan Neighborhood Reinvents Itself
headline.print_headline: Like Magic, a District Comes to Life

docs.abstract: In 2008, policymakers rescued the economy but raised a divisive debate about the fairness of using tax dollars to save companies. Get ready for a repeat.
docs.snippet: In 2008, policymakers rescued the economy but raised a divisive debate about the fairness of using tax dollars to save companies. Get ready for a repeat.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bailouts. Stimulus. Corporate socialism. Welfare for business.

headline.main: Let’s Talk About Coronavirus Bailouts, Before We Need Them
headline.print_headline: Let’s Start the Conversation About Coronavirus Bailouts

docs.abstract: President Trump, surrounded by business leaders, said coronavirus tests would soon be more widely available. Investors pushed the market up nearly 10 percent.
docs.snippet: President Trump, surrounded by business leaders, said coronavirus tests would soon be more widely available. Investors pushed the market up nearly 10 percent.
docs.lead_paragraph: The stock market roared back to life on Friday, with the S&P surging 9.3 percent after President Trump said the government would speed up coronavirus testing for Americans. In doing so, he delivered investors exactly the message they had been waiting to hear — a half-hour before the market closed.

headline.main: Stocks Surge After Trump Promises Speedier Coronavirus Testing
headline.print_headline: Trillions in Value Erased, and Then a Surge of Hope

docs.abstract: Mr. Gates, who founded the company with Paul Allen four decades ago, will also step down from the board of Berkshire Hathaway.
docs.snippet: Mr. Gates, who founded the company with Paul Allen four decades ago, will also step down from the board of Berkshire Hathaway.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Bill Gates is stepping down from the board of Microsoft, the software giant he helped found more than four decades ago.

headline.main: Bill Gates Stepping Down From Microsoft’s Board
headline.print_headline: Gates Leaving Microsoft and Berkshire Hathaway Boards

byline.original: By Daisuke Wakabayashi and Steve Lohr

docs.abstract: A Tennessee man had planned to sell his stockpile at marked-up prices online. Now he is under investigation for price gouging.
docs.snippet: A Tennessee man had planned to sell his stockpile at marked-up prices online. Now he is under investigation for price gouging.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Tennessee man who became a subject of national scorn after stockpiling 17,700 bottles of hand sanitizer donated all of the supplies on Sunday just as the Tennessee attorney general’s office began investigating him for price gouging.

headline.main: The Man With 17,700 Bottles of Hand Sanitizer Just Donated Them
headline.print_headline: After Furor, Reseller Parts With Reserve  Of Sanitizer

docs.abstract: Cinemas, already contending with streaming services, are now facing the prospect of no audiences and no new films because of the coronavirus pandemic.
docs.snippet: Cinemas, already contending with streaming services, are now facing the prospect of no audiences and no new films because of the coronavirus pandemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — For most of last week, movie theater executives clung grimly on.

headline.main: Movie Crowds Stay Away. Theaters Hope It’s Not for Good.
headline.print_headline: Will Empty Theaters Stay That Way?

byline.original: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling

docs.abstract: G.M., Ford Motor and Fiat Chrysler were under pressure from the autoworkers union to shut down plants in response to the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.snippet: G.M., Ford Motor and Fiat Chrysler were under pressure from the autoworkers union to shut down plants in response to the coronavirus outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: With fear of infection rising among factory workers, and few customers shopping for cars, several automakers on Wednesday decided to idle their plants in the United States, Canada and Mexico for at least a week. The decisions will put tens of thousands of people out of work and add to the coronavirus outbreak’s growing economic toll.

headline.main: Automakers to Close Factories in North America
headline.print_headline: Automakers Will Idle Factories in North America

docs.abstract: Ed Catmull and Pat Hanrahan created computer techniques that remade animation, special effects, virtual reality and artificial intelligence.
docs.snippet: Ed Catmull and Pat Hanrahan created computer techniques that remade animation, special effects, virtual reality and artificial intelligence.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Pat Hanrahan was a young biophysics student at the University of Wisconsin-Madison in the 1980s when he decided to give up his work with microscopic insects and join a small group of computer scientists in their quest to make a movie.

headline.main: Pixar Pioneers Win $1 Million Turing Award
headline.print_headline: Pixar Pioneers Win Turing Award for Going to Infinity and Beyond
